member.name: Point.Equals
member.summary: The Point.Equals method determines whether twoPoint objects are equal. Two points are considered equal if they have the sameX andY data members.
member.param: Reference to aPoint object that is compared to thisPoint object.
member.returns: If thePoint objects are equal, this method returns TRUE; otherwise, it returns FALSE.

member.name: Point.Point
member.summary: Creates a new Point object and copies the data members from another Point object.
member.param: Reference to a Point object whoseX andY data members are copied into theX andY data members of the new Point object.

member.name: Point.Point
member.summary: Creates a Point object using aSize object to initialize theX andY data members.
member.param: Reference to aSize object whoseWidth data member specifies theX data member of this Point object, and whoseHeight data member specifies theY data member of this Point object.

member.name: Point.Point
member.summary: Creates a Point object using two integers to initialize theX andY data members.
member.param: Integer that specifies the x-coordinate of the Point object.
Integer that specifies the y-coordinate of the Point object.

member.name: Point.Point
member.summary: Creates a Point object and initializes theX andY data members to zero. This is the default constructor.
